description: Class members participate in a team research project abroad.  The central activity of the project
teams is to implement an applied research project in collaboration with a host
community in West Africa.  This research project drives the other elements of the course, which
include readings from the research literature, ethical analysis of their project applying CSCI 263
principles, documentation practices, and writing a research paper for public presentation.
Offered periodically during January Term. Apply through the Smith Center for Global Engagement.
Prerequisites: computer science major with senior standing and completion of or concurrent
enrollment in computer science core courses, ordinarily including CSCI 353 and CSCI 263, or
